summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, scheduling a telephone conference for October 21, 2021, to discuss jury selection matters. It provides public and private dial-in information for the proceeding and prohibits recording or rebroadcasting.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the court order.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge who issued the order scheduling the telephone conference and setting the rules for public access.

events.title: Jury Selection Telephone Conference
events.description: The court schedules a telephone conference to discuss jury selection matters for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The court scheduled a telephone conference for October 21, 2021, to discuss jury selection in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The public and press in the U.S. could access a live audio feed of the proceeding via a provided phone number and access code.
A separate, private dial-in number was to be provided to counsel, the defendant, alleged victims, and family members.
Photographing, recording, or rebroadcasting the federal court proceeding was strictly prohibited, with potential fines or sanctions for violations.
The order was issued by United States District Judge Alison J. Nathan.
